title: 802-B
statement: B. Heidi and Library (medium)time limit per test10 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutWhereas humans nowadays read fewer and fewer books on paper, book readership among marmots has surged. Heidi has expanded the library and is now serving longer request sequences.InputSame as the easy version, but the limits have changed:1 ≤n,k≤ 400 000.OutputSame as the easy version.ExamplesInput4 1001 2 2 1Output2Input4 11 2 2 1Output3Input4 21 2 3 1Output3

processed.result:
You are given an array of $n$ integers representing the number of books in each shelf of a library. You also have an integer $k$ representing the maximum number of shelves you can visit.  You want to find the maximum number of books you can collect by visiting at most $k$ shelves.  You can visit shelves in any order. 

The input consists of four integers: $n$, $k$, $a_1$, and $a_2$.

* $n$ is the number of shelves.
* $k$ is the maximum number of shelves you can visit.
* $a_1$ and $a_2$ are two integers representing the number of books on the first and second shelves, respectively.

Output the maximum number of books you can collect.
You are given a list of numbers and a target number. Find the minimum number of numbers from the list that add up to the target number.
